item.title: Ecologist Dr Faith Coleman steps down from government panels after allegations of political interference
item.description: South Australian ecologist Dr Faith Coleman has resigned from two state government algal bloom panels and criticised the state government's approach.

item.title: Space station astronauts splash down after first-ever medical evacuation
item.description: A capsule carrying four International Space Station crew members has splashed down in the Pacific, bringing their mission to an end more than a month early.

item.title: Astronauts return from ISS with sick crew member
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: More than 4.7m social media accounts closed in two days after ban began, data reveals
item.description: More than 4.7 million Australian social media accounts have been deactivated since laws banning children aged under 16 took effect in December, according to data released by the government.

item.title: Antidepressants less effective for many living with atypical depression, new study finds
item.description: A major Australian study finds standard antidepressants are not effective for about 20 per cent of people, who may need alternative treatments.

item.title: Pulp agree to Adelaide Festival show after apology to Randa Abdel-Fattah
item.description: In a social media post, British indie band Pulp says it had previously informed festival organisers of its decision to withdraw but was asked "to delay an announcement while [organisers] sought to resolve this crisis for all sides", and it had now agreed to perform.

item.title: Trump threatens to invoke Insurrection Act over Minnesota anti-ICE protests
item.description: Such a move would allow the president to deploy troops to quell persistent protests in the city of Minneapolis, where two shootings connected to immigration crackdowns are fuelling public anger.

item.title: Great Ocean Road flash flooding leaves beach towns to count the cost
item.description: The Lorne caravan park will be closed for weeks after record-breaking rains turned into "terrifying" floodwaters, sweeping cars into the ocean and inundating holiday parks along Victoria's Great Ocean Road.

item.title: Heated Rivalry and growing sports romance genre can teach lessons about queer inclusion
item.description: Heated Rivalry has become a massive global hit, but can the steamy ice hockey romance, and other queer love stories, help create more inclusive spaces in the real sporting world?

item.title: Fight brewing on national gun reform as states splinter on party lines
item.description: A split is emerging at a state level over the government's plan to establish a national gun buyback scheme following the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: What is in the government's new hate speech laws?
item.description: Parliament will return early next week to debate new hate speech laws. But what exactly does the legislation include?

item.title: Energy giant AGL offers cash for conservation amid grid strains
item.description: In a move labelled a sign of the times, energy firm AGL was last week offering customers money to cut use during a heatwave.

item.title: Hundreds of satellite images capture Victoria's destructive bushfires erupting
item.description: Hundreds of images captured by an orbiting weather satellite, and stitched together by the ABC, show the scale and destructive force of the Victorian bushfires.

item.title: Former Whyalla steelworks owner's $18.5 million royalties debt revealed
item.description: The former owner of the Whyalla steelworks, Sanjeev Gupta's OneSteel Manufacturing, owed $18.5 million in royalties when it was forced into administration last year, the ABC can reveal.

item.title: Locals oppose tearing down of Bondi terror attack bridge at Waverley Council meeting
item.description: Waverley Council held an extraordinary meeting last night, but the future of the footbridge used by the Bondi gunmen remains undecided.

item.title: Calls for greater public awareness about battery dangers after fires at regional landfill sites
item.description: People are being urged to dispose of their batteries properly, after a series of fires at landfills across New South Wales.

item.title: Queensland woman wakes up to find carpet python on top of her
item.description: It's fair to say when a Brisbane resident woke up to discover a carpet python curled up on top of her, she was rattled.

item.title: Child slapped in the face among inappropriate educator discipline exposed in Canberra childcare document dump
item.description: Documents detailing five years' worth of childcare breaches in the ACT reveal cases of educators slapping children, forcibly shaking them, throwing them, and possessing child exploitation material.

item.title: Finn Allen smashes maiden BBL century as Perth Scorchers book finals spot
item.description: Finn Allen saves his best ever BBL innings for when it matters most as the Perth Scorchers out-duel the Melbourne Renegades.

item.description: Documents leaked to the ABC reveal an "apocalyptic Christian cult" is targeting Ballarat, Bendigo, Geelong and Darwin.

item.description: Chloé Zhao's retelling of the life of William Shakespeare is on the fast track to the Academy Awards, but at times feels like Oscar-bait.

item.title: The NT's last private obstetrician walks away as maternity services face collapse
item.description: A growing number of women in the Northern Territory are travelling interstate to give birth — or leaving the territory altogether — following the sudden closure of the only private hospital maternity ward. Now, the NT's last private obstetrician is closing her practice.

item.description: Wildlife officials on Christmas Island, the remote territory 2,600 kilometres north-west of Perth, are welcoming the final chapter of its famous red crab migration — the return to shore of millions of baby crabs.

item.description: Two wineries in the Strathbogie Ranges have lost a combined 150 hectares of vines, 3,000 sheep and three homes in the Victorian fires.

item.description: Jakara Anthony has claimed her 26th moguls title to become Australia's most successful World Cup skier in an imposing sign ahead of next month's Olympics.

item.title: Michael Zerafa has been accused of quitting against Nikita Tszyu. There is no more heinous crime in boxing
item.description: To be called a quitter is the lowest insult in boxing. But whether Michael Zerafa was guilty of this or not, he has successfully ostracised himself from the sport's fraternity for the second time in his career.

item.description: The Australian Liv AlUla Jayco team is out to rescue its women's Tour Down Under campaign after a painful start in Saturday's opening stage.

item.title: Why Abbey Barrett's mum wants more federal government funding for brain cancer research
item.description: Abbey was "joy on two legs" and now she is gone, another lost to brain cancer. Somehow her family must carry on, as the fight continues for more funding to bring this horror disease to an end.

item.description: Authorities destroying bike jumps built illegally by kids is not a new thing, but research indicates that those authorities should instead seek to work with young people, like Zeke Woolcock, on building trails.

item.description: The State Emergency Service responds to more than 2,300 incidents and 25 flood rescues, most of which involve people driving through floodwaters.

item.title: Torres Strait Islanders commemorate the legacy of 1936 pearl industry maritime strike

item.description: It was a busy day at Melbourne Park but it was the night session that saw both the men's and women's world number ones progressing.

item.title: A deadly fire tears through a shopping centre in Pakistan.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Deadly Pakistan shopping plaza fire fuelled by clothes and homewares
item.description: Authorities fear the death toll from a fire in Karachi could grow, with the cause of the fire not immediately known.

item.title: Israel objects to US announcement of leaders who will help oversee next steps in Gaza
item.description: The committee announced by the White House includes no Israeli officials but has an Israeli businessperson, billionaire Yakir Gabay.

item.title: Victoria's animal populations suffer as state is ravaged by bushfires, extreme heat
item.description: From animal shelters to "entire generations" of bat colonies, heartbreaking stories of the significant loss of animal life are beginning to emerge in the wake of Victoria's disastrous bushfires and severe heat.

item.title: Status of hate laws remains uncertain as politicians converge on Canberra
item.description: A special sitting to respond to the Bondi terror attack will begin in Canberra on Monday, but the government is no closer to landing changes to hate laws.

item.title: Fire sends huge plumes above Adelaide but firefighters stop spread to batteries
item.description: About 90 firefighters have been battling a large blaze at Croydon Park that sent a large plume of smoke above the suburbs and came close to batteries for home solar systems.

item.title: US says it killed Al Qaeda operative linked to deadly IS ambush of Americans in Syria
item.description: CENTCOM says it conducted a strike in north-west Syria that resulted in the death of an Al Qaeda operative linked to the ISIS gunman responsible for killing two US soldiers and a US civilian in Syria on December 13.

item.title: Tunarama's return lures big fish back to seafood capital
item.description: Port Lincoln's world-famous Tunarama Festival has returned to the South Australian event calendar, with thousands of people lining the streets to celebrate the seafood industry.

item.title: Smoke billows from a fire at Croydon Park, Adelaide
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: NBA great Allen Iverson meets hundreds of fans in Australia, including NBL star Bryce Cotton
item.description: NBA great Allen Iverson left hundreds of fans star struck at a meet-and-greet event in Perth, none more so than one of the best NBL players of all time.

item.title: WA government announces Department of Health taskforce to crack down on illicit tobacco trade
item.description: A taskforce will be assembled to combat Western Australia's illicit tobacco market, with plans to pull retired and current police officers into the Department of Health.

item.title: Pasa Faho to screen at Sydney Opera House after creating a bit of buzz
item.description: Pasa Faho is the story of a shoe salesman who struggles to save his small business and pass on his values to his son.

item.title: World's first legally binding treaty to protect oceans and marine life takes effect
item.description: The High Seas Treaty will govern about two-thirds of the planet's oceans including vast areas beyond any country's borders.

item.title: RBA cash rate 2026: cuts or hikes coming?
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Denver Broncos quarterback Bo Nix's season-ending ankle injury throws Super Bowl race wide open
item.description: As the final four NFL teams prepare to battle it out for a place in the Super Bowl, a last-minute injury to Denver quarterback Bo Nix has thrown the race for the championship into chaos.

item.title: Flood warnings continue as Queensland stock losses to hit more than 100,000
item.description: Numerous flood warnings remain active across central Queensland, with ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji still driving floodwater through major catchments, while the premier met with graziers on Sunday to discuss massive stock losses.

item.title: Talia Gibson moves through to Australian Open second round
item.description: Talia Gibson prides herself on her aggressive on-court approach, which was on full display in her convincing first-round victory at Melbourne Park.

item.title: Darwin gathers for Geektacular cosplay event celebrating geek culture
item.description: Has a surge in the popularity of hit shows like Stranger Things led to an uptick in geekiness, changing how we feel about nerd culture? The ABC attended Darwin's Geektacular event to find out.

item.title: Why Alex de Minaur will lean into his 'selfish' side for the Australian Open
item.description: As the nation's great hope for the Australian Open, Alex de Minaur is ready to unleash his selfish side in an effort to secure his first grand slam title.

item.title: Boy, 12, in critical condition after being bitten by a large shark at Sydney Harbour beach
item.description: Emergency services were called to Hermitage Foreshore Walk near Shark Beach at Vaucluse about 4:20pm on Sunday afternoon following reports of a boy being bitten by a shark.

item.title: Great Britain wins SailGP Perth, beating Australia and France
item.description: Reigning Sail Grand Prix champions Great Britain make the best possible start to season 2026, taking the win in Fremantle with a strong two-day performance culminating with victory in Sunday's final.

item.title: Ally Wollaston claims stage two of Tour Down Under to maintain race lead
item.description: Kiwi Ally Wollaston has outsprinted defending champion Noemi Ruegg to claim stage two of the Tour Down Under and keep the race lead.

item.title: Writers' Week letter shows premier backed removal of Randa Abdel-Fattah
item.description: South Australia's premier told the Adelaide Festival board it would open itself to "accusations of hypocrisy" and "legitimate public ridicule" if it did not cancel the appearance of Randa Abdel-Fattah from Writers' Week.

item.title: Crews respond to Rose Bay shark attack.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Dozens of WA fishers congregate to protest against ban on demersal fishing
item.description: Dozens of disgruntled fishers have journeyed through the streets of Perth to protest against the state government's decision to ban demersal fishing, as the WA Premier Roger Cook confirmed he planned to meet with the industry.

item.title: Tourists warned to avoid Fitzgerald River National Park as bushfire hits Emergency Warning
item.description: Tourists are warned to avoid Fitzgerald River National Park, 500 kilometres south-east of Perth, as a bushfire burning in the park is escalated to an Emergency Warning and evacuation centres open.

item.title: Body found among wreckage of Indonesian plane that lost contact mid-flight
item.description: A body has been found among the wreckage of an Indonesian plane that lost contact mid-flight.

item.title: Aryna Sabalenka advances to Australian Open second round at Melbourne Park
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka again proves she is compulsive viewing, as she moves through to the second round with a straight-sets win at the Australian Open.

item.title: Venus Williams lost in the first round. But she still gave fans an emotional evening
item.description: Undisputed great of the sport Venus Williams was welcomed back to Melbourne Park with multiple standing ovations but bowed out in the first round to Serbian Olga Danilovic.

item.title: NATO allies warn Trump of 'dangerous downward spiral' over Greenland threats
item.description: The US president says European countries will be hit with tariffs until a deal is struck that would see the Danish territory become an American possession.

item.title: Trump asks Australia, Albanese to join Gaza 'Board of Peace'
item.description: The US president is pushing for the board to preserve a fragile ceasefire between Hamas and Israel and progress the peace deal to the next phase.

item.title: Unregulated fishing keeps Seahorse World locked out of traditional Chinese medicine market
item.description: A seahorse farm in Tasmania thought it was onto a sure thing; exporting dried seahorses to the Chinese market — it turned out not to be as easy as hoped.

item.title: This week in history quiz: Can you conquer these questions?
item.description: Trips to the moon and Mars, same-sex marriage and the first canned beer appear in this week's line-up.

item.title: What psychologists have to say about the seven types of rest
item.description: Have you ever found yourself still exhausted and deflated after an eight-hour sleep? Perhaps sleep isn't the reset you need.

item.title: AI platforms like Grok are an ethical, social and economic nightmare — and we're starting to wake up
item.description: As 2025 began, I thought humanity's biggest problem was climate change. In 2026, AI is more pressing.

item.title: Sam Short's small leap to ocean swimming and the prospect of more Australian success in 2032
item.description: Sam Short will take on the country's best open water swimmers at the Australian Nationals this week, with a possible new event for Brisbane 2032 opening new opportunities for Australian gold.

item.title: Life in Cuba is about to get harder as Trump threatens oil supply
item.description: Many experts are predicting life in Cuba is about to get even harder.

item.title: How Melbourne became a headline-making city as home prices elsewhere soared
item.description: Property analysts say a mix of economic conditions, policy settings and demographic shifts are among the reasons for the city's subdued dwelling price growth in the past five years.

item.title: Parents of Bondi victim Matilda pay tribute to mystery woman who saved their younger daughter
item.description: The parents of 10-year-old Matilda, the youngest victim of the Bondi terror attack, recall the final moments leading up to the shooting, paying tribute to the woman who saved their younger daughter.

item.title: What Trump has planned for 'the biggest birthday party ever' as the US turns 250
item.description: The United States of America is celebrating the 250th anniversary of its union as a nation and experts say Donald Trump appears to be exploiting the events for his own political gain.

item.title: Tribunal bans senior nurse for trying to take patient's medication, altering hospital records
item.description: A senior public hospital nurse has been prohibited from working for four years for attempting to steal medication from a patient and manipulating a co-worker's Facebook account in an attempt to cover it up.

item.title: Frustrated fans, Zverev confused and a ball kid collapses — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: Fans were left queuing for hours after play started, Alexander Zverev got confused by a gate and Maria Sakkari smashed an insane shot. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

item.title: Steve Smith amuses and delights, Sam Curran fires as the Sydney Sixers lock in BBL finals berth
item.description: Steve Smith oscillates between the ridiculous and the sublime as the Sydney Sixers get the better of the Brisbane Heat in a do-or-die clash at the Gabba.

item.title: Everything you need to know about the new $800m Sydney Fish Market
item.description: It is perhaps the most expensive seafood centre of its kind, but just what can visitors expect from the new $800 million Sydney Fish Market?

item.title: Pentagon could deploy troops to Minnesota protests, US officials say
item.description: The possible deployment comes after US President Donald Trump threatened to invoke the Insurrection Act to quell anti-ICE protests in the state.

item.title: Jared Abbott says heat policies drive good behaviour.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Calls for an industry-standard heat policy to be implemented on worksites as summers get hotter
item.description: It has been 13 years since Jenny Newport's son died from extreme heat while on a worksite in Queensland. She believes not much has changed.

item.title: ASX-listed coal mine company buries report into whistleblower allegations
item.description: An investigation into whistleblower allegations finds senior managers at a NSW coal mine were involved in a decision by the mine to award their own companies multi-million-dollar contracts.

item.title: The highly detailed, invisible work that goes into 'near real-time' bushfire mapping
item.description: As the devastating fires in Victoria spread earlier this month, people at home could see how they were moving across the state — not just in videos on the news and social media, but on an interactive map.

item.title: Federal politics live: Parliament returns to pay tribute to victims of Bondi terror attack
item.description: Parliament has returned ahead of schedule to honour the victims of the Bondi terror attack. Follow live.

item.title: Live updates: Wall Street closes flat ahead of long weekend, ASX on edge ahead of tariff threat fallout
item.description: The ASX is on edge after a renewed escalation on trade tensions between the US and Europe and ahead of key Chinese data. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Meals you can get kids on board with
item.description: We’ve put together four recipes that are fun and easy enough for kids to help with.

item.title: Three performers talk about bringing their clown shows to Perth Fringe World
item.description: Three performers at Perth Fringe World talk about why the magic of clowning is getting adults to let down their walls and embrace their inner child.

item.title: Tony Clark hopes to inspire new generation as Hepburn Shire Council mayor
item.description: A new Victorian mayor is already challenging the way his council thinks about inclusivity.

item.title: Adam Lambert breaks through for maiden snowboard cross World Cup win on eve of Olympics
item.description: Adam Lambert completes another tremendous weekend for Australia's Winter Olympic hopes by racing to his first snowboard cross World Cup win.

item.title: Shark attack at Sydney Harbour beach leaves boy in intensive care with critical injuries
item.description: Police say the boy was pulled aboard a vessel by water police officers "within minutes" of the Triple Zero call being made.

item.title: Charles Darwin University researchers investigate whether old tyres can strengthen roads
item.description: Roads buckle under the pressure of the Northern Territory's harsh climate, but a group of researchers think repurposing discarded materials may be the solution — not only helping the environment, but government budgets too.

item.title: Boundary Road level crossing upgrade stalls indefinitely as Transport and Main Road reneges on construction date
item.description: The Queensland government evicted shopkeepers in Coopers Plains to make way for construction that was due to begin in mid-2025 but is yet to happen.

item.title: Fire rips through grass and scrub at Tooperang near Mount Compass
item.description: Hundreds of firefighters have been battling a scrub fire burning near Mount Compass south of Adelaide, which remains uncontrolled.

item.title: Gordonvale man to face court charged with domestic violence murder of woman
item.description: A 29-year-old man is due to face court in Cairns today after a 29-year-old woman's death.

item.title: Man injured in 40 metre cliff fall at Black Rock in Melbourne's south
item.description: The 18-year-old suffered spinal, arm and leg injuries after falling onto a ledge at Half Moon Bay in Black Rock on Sunday night.

item.title: Conservationists alarmed by plan to remove rare bird habitat in Sydney's north-west
item.description: A set of ponds built for a since-shuttered abattoir in Sydney's north-west has become a habitat for rare migratory birds from Alaska and Antarctica.

item.title: Two people injured in shooting at Huntfield Heights, police say
item.description: SA Police say paramedics are currently at a home in Huntfield Heights treating two people with gunshot injuries, which are not believed to be life-threatening.

item.title: Cross-cultural sharing is at the heart of Townsville's community garden
item.description: In the heart of north Queensland, Ukrainians, Fijians, Zimbabweans and Koreans gather in the dirt to help each other grow vegetables.

item.title: At least five dead, 25 others injured after two high-speed trains derailed in Spain
item.description: At least five people have died and 25 others are severely injured after two high-speed trains derailed in southern Spain, local emergency services say.

item.title: Violent crime spreading to regional towns as WA waits for strengthened tobacco laws
item.description: Community leaders have called on the West Australian government to take concrete action as violence and crime associated with the illegal tobacco trade spreads to the state's Wheatbelt.
